com.mishmash.rally
Class Hand

java.lang.Object
  com.mishmash.rally.Hand

public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object

This represents the fundamental purpose of the program, a 'hand' of cards. A hand is not limited in size, though it must have at least one card and contain no duplicates (which effectively limits its size to 53, but if we change the properties of a deck this will not be the case).

Author:
mrmcduff

Field Detail

FIVE_CARD_DRAW_HAND_SIZE

public static final int FIVE_CARD_DRAW_HAND_SIZE
No matter how many cards are in the hand, a hand is scored by its best five cards. If there are less than five cards in the hand, it is impossible to make a straight or a flush, but you could still have a pair (or two), high card, or three or four of a kind.

See Also:

Method Detail

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Checks to see whether or not this is a valid hand.

Returns:
True if the hand is nonempty, contains no invalid cards, and contains no duplicates.

getHandSize

public int getHandSize()
Getter for the number of cards in this hand.

Returns:
The number of cards in this hand.

getHandType

public Hand.HandType getHandType()
Getter for the type of this hand. Note that it defaults to HandType.HIGH_CARD and doesn't change without the help of an evaluator. If the hand has not already been evaluated, it calls its own evaluator to get that value before returning an answer.

Returns:
The type field of this hand.

getCards

A shallow copy of the set of all cards.

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Gets a pretty-printable string describing the hand based on its contents.

Returns:
A string suitable for user consumption describing the hand.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this hand is in an invalid state for printing. This includes if the important cards are not set, or if the second important cards are required but not set.
